Calls a Function Provided by the User

Source: R/call_user_fun.R
call_user_fun.Rd

r lifecycle::badge("deprecated") Calls a function provided by the user and adds the function call to the error message if the call fails.

Usage 

call_user_fun(call)

Arguments

call

Call to be executed

Default value

none

Value

The return value of the function call

See also

Other deprecated: date_source(), derive_param_extreme_record(), derive_var_dthcaus(), derive_var_extreme_dt(), derive_var_extreme_dtm(), dthcaus_source(), get_summary_records()

Examples 

call_user_fun(compute_bmi(
  height = 172,
  weight = 60
))
#> `call_user_fun()` was deprecated in admiral 1.3.0.
#> â„¹ `call_user_fun()` is no longer supported and no replacement is provided;
#> â„¹ The original code for this function is here:
#> â„¹ https://github.com/pharmaverse/admiral/blob/v1.2.0/R/call_user_fun.R#L26-L39
#> [1] 20.28123

try(call_user_fun(compute_bmi(
  height = 172,
  weight = "hallo"
)))
#> Error in call_user_fun(compute_bmi(height = 172, weight = "hallo")) : 
#>   Calling `compute_bmi(height = 172, weight = "hallo")` caused the
#> following error:
#> Argument `weight` must be a numeric vector, but it is a string.
